private_information: I arrive at Richmond District at 09:00
traveler.goal: Meet as many friends as possible today, with a specific desire to meet Sarah for at least 105 minutes.

private_information: I will be at Presidio from 13:15 to 15:15
sarah.goal: Meet the traveler if schedules overlap for at least 105 minutes within my Presidio window.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent availability and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that maximizes meetings while satisfying constraints, including the minimum meeting duration with Sarah.

public_information: Travel time from Richmond District to Presidio is 7 minutes
Travel time from Presidio to Richmond District is 7 minutes
You arrive at Richmond District at 09:00
Sarah will be at Presidio from 13:15 to 15:15
Desired minimum meeting time with Sarah is 105 minutes

availability.system_prompt: You are the traveler planning a day in San Francisco. Provide your availability windows and any constraints or preferences relevant to meeting friends. Do not output PDDL. Provide the information in a concise machine readable form.
availability.prompt: You are traveler. You arrive at Richmond District at 09:00. You want to meet as many friends as possible today and you would like to meet Sarah for at least 105 minutes. Based on the public information about locations and travel times, provide your availability windows, mobility constraints, and any meeting preferences in a concise, machine readable format.

availability.system_prompt: You are Sarah providing your availability. Report the exact time window(s) you can meet and any constraints. Do not output PDDL. Provide the information in a concise machine readable form.
availability.prompt: You are sarah. You will be at Presidio from 13:15 to 15:15. Based on the public information, provide your availability windows and any constraints or preferences relevant to meeting the traveler.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Integrate availability reports and public information to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem tailored to the FastDownwards planner. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct. The PDDL must model time as integer minutes, travel actions, meeting actions, availability windows, and an objective to maximize the number of friends met while enforcing the constraint to meet Sarah for at least 105 minutes when feasible.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the traveler and Sarah availability reports. Integrate them with the public information about locations and travel times and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeted to FastDownwards. The encoding should use integer time (minutes), include travel actions with given durations, meeting actions with durations, availability time windows for locations, and an optimization objective to maximize meetings while satisfying the minimum meeting duration with Sarah. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
